oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:title: Photomontage fox hunters, Henry Ford with a train replica, children, the Tullahoma Rotary Club president, and a family portrait. Nashville Banner, 1927 October 30.
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:subject: Harper, N. F.; Ford, Henry; Hungerford, Edward; Barnett, Lionel; Stanton, James Wilton; Horton, John W.; Roper, Mrs. Mattie E.; Long, Mrs. Albert M.; Hemby, Mrs. Van Buren; Hemby, Van, Jr.
Nashville Banner
Hunting; Dogs; Railroad trains; Men; Children; Families
Nashville (Tenn.)--History--Sources; Nashville (Tenn.)--Social life and customs; Nashville and Davidson County (Tenn.)--History--Sources
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:description: Photomontage of the Southern Kentucky Fox Hunters' Association in Scottsville, Kentucky, Henry Ford standing in front of a train replica, an English child, a Nashville child wearing headphones, the president of the Tullahoma rotary club, and a family portrait showing four generations. 16 x 21.5 in. Forms part of the Nashville Newspaper Rotogravure Digital Images Collection.
